Title: Electronics Engineer - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Type: Full Time, Permanent
Start Date: As soon as possible
Language: English
Minimum Education: Bachelor's Degree
Positions Available: 5
NOC Group: Electrical and Electronics Engineers (2133)
NOC Job Title: Engineer, Electronics
Expires in 4 days
Expires: 2021-11-26
Posted: 2021-11-19
Last Updated: 2021-11-19
Job Location(s)
970 Burrard Street
Vancouver, British Columbia
V6Z 2R4, Canada
Job Description
We are looking for Electronics Engineer to join our Electrical Team at
our office in Downtown Vancouver. The Electronics Engineer will participate in
developing and designing new product prototypes. Occasional travel may be required.
We provide a great environment to learn and develop new technology in a small team setting. Our office follows a business-casual dress code, and is a short walk away from Burrard Skytrain Station. At EPIC, you can expect a welcoming environment where you can safely learn and grow.
Responsibilities
Here are some of the things you’ll be doing as an Electronics Engineer:
Design experiments for process and product development·
Assemble and test prototype and pre-production products·
Investigate origin and cause of failures, damages or defects in electrical fields·
Evaluate off-the-shelf and custom drivers, components, PCBs, PCAs, etc.·
Analyze and solder PCBs·
Develop software systems to control circuits and other electronic segments·
Write reports on technological developments in the industry·
Ensure designs meet regulations and quality standards by the IPC, FCC, IC, etc.·
Collaborate with others in R·&D projects
Core Requirements
We are looking for candidates with the following requirements:
Post-secondary education in Electrical and Electronics Engineering or a related·
field
Proficient in the design, schematic capture, simulation and layout of electronics·
Excellent attention to detail·
Knowledge of electronic, analog, and digital concepts·
Strong communication skills·
Experience working as part of a team·
Solid grounding in physics and mathematics fundamentals·
Experience working with tight deadlines·
Knowledge of EMI and EMC testing·
Strong knowledge of the Microsoft Office Suite and Google app equivalents·
Nice-to-Haves
Special consideration will be given to candidates with:
2+ years’ experience in Engineering·
Safety certification experience·
Application Requirements
To apply for this position, please submit a copy of your resume to:
jobs@epic-semiconductors.com
Privacy and confidentiality are important to us. All applications are kept strictly
confidential and we will not share your information with anyone without your prior approval.
We look forward to hearing about your knowledge, skills, and experiences! We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only short-listed candidates will be contacted.
For more information, visit our website:
https://www.epic-semiconductors.com/
How to Apply
Expiring: Nov 26, 2021
Email: jobs@epic-semiconductors.com

Title: Mine Engineer In Training - Mayo, YT - Indeed.com
Description:
Mine Engineer In Training
Victoria Gold Corp
Mayo, YT
Full Time
Mining
Duration
Permanent
Intended job posting audience
Anyone who can legally work in Canada can apply for this job. If you are not currently authorized to work in Canada, the employer will not consider your job application.
Victoria Gold Corp.
(“Victoria”) is a mining company with an Executive team that is experienced in developing and operating mines in an environmentally and socially responsible manner. Victoria’s Eagle Gold Mine poured its first gold in September 2019 and declared commercial production at the end of Q2 2020. Future and current mines, like Eagle Gold, will be a strong contributor to the Yukon and its citizens for many years to come. www.vgcx.com
Victoria is looking to hire the position outlined below for our
Eagle Gold Mine
located in Yukon:
Mine Engineer-In-Training (EIT)
Under the direction of the Senior Mine Engineer the EIT will participate in the Engineer-In-Training program. The position will involve assignments in a variety of Mining departments with rotation to include: Ore Control, Drill/Blast, Geotechnical Projects, Mine Operations, Short Range and Long-Range Planning. This role will support the Technical Services Department in various design and planning activities to ensure service and operating standards are met and aligned to the organization’s long-term goals. The role contributes to continuous business improvement through identifying and developing initiatives that add value to the business. This position will work on a rotational basis with a shift of 12-hours a day. Responsibilities will include but are not limited to:
Main Tasks and Responsibilities:
Maintain day to day production tracking of main key performance indicators and ensure production requirements are met as per budget in compliance with safety and engineering standards;
Maintain constant communication with geology grade control team to ensure ore delineation is completed in a timely fashion;
Engage in improvement efforts to achieve budgets, production, operating and cost-efficiencies;
Provide and validate inputs to daily, weekly, and monthly reports;
Assist in developing and implementing the company policies and procedures related to Mine Engineering; and
Be a leader of both safety and production for the team by ensuring compliance with all Company and legislated safety policies and procedures.
Qualifications and Experience:
Proof of being fully vaccinated for COVID-19;
Must pass pre-employment medical, pre-employment substance abuse test, criminal records check and provide a driver’s abstract;
A B.Sc in Mining Engineering or related Engineering;
Registration as an EIT with a Professional Engineering Association;
A minimum of 0-2 years of related experience is preferred;
Strong commitment to safe work practices; and
Knowledge of mining processes.
Victoria Gold Corp. offers a competitive compensation and benefits package. If you are excited about this opportunity and feel you meet the expectations of the role, please send us your resume with the email subject headline “Mine Technician/EIT” to the following email address:
greatpeoplework@vgcx.com

Title: Mechanical Engineer (Remote) - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Mechanical Engineer
Dynamic Air Shelters (www.dynamicairshelters.com) is a fully integrated engineering, design, service and manufacturer of air-beam, fabric shelters. We provide innovative solutions for global customers in the oil & gas/petro-chemical refining, construction, industrial and mining sectors. The manufacturing operation is in Grand Bank and Fortune, NL. We are an ISO-9001:2015 registered company and have acquired a Certificate of Recognition (COR) from the Newfoundland and Labrador Construction Safety Association (NLCSA). We are proud of our facility and our product. We are committed to our core values of being safe, accurate, innovative, respectful and dynamic in everything we do.
Job Function:
The Mechanical Engineer is responsible to perform all duties and assigned tasks in accordance with Dynamic Air Shelters Ltd.’s policies, procedures and work instructions. It is a remote position (work from home) with occasional travel required.
Specific tasks could include but are not limited to:
Aid in development of a systematic approach to produce technical drawings for production purposes. You will provide oversight to our SolidWorks designer in completing the modularization of our shelters.
Confer with management, production and sales staff to discuss project specifications and procedures.
Coordinate and direct R&D projects, create detailed plans to accomplish goals and direct the integration of technical activities.
Direct, review and ensure approved product design and changes.
Develop and test models of alternate designs and process methods to assess feasibility, operating condition effects, possible new applications and necessity of modifications to shelter components.
Develop and implement policies, standards and procedures for the engineering and technical work performed.
Develop specifications for system components or direct modification of products to ensure conformance with engineering design and performance specifications.
Oversee the process that determines the acceptability of materials for our products.
Ensure procurement staff are provided detailed information with approved product specifications for purchase and use in our product.
Ensure product installation/operational manuals are developed for new products and existing manuals are updated as needed.
Perform administrative functions such as reviewing and writing reports or performance requirements for product development or engineering projects.
Consult and negotiate with clients to prepare project specifications.
Set scientific and technical goals with broad outlines provided by management.
Job-Related Employment Requirements
Education
A bachelor’s degree in engineering and registration as a professional engineer in Canada or equivalent
Key Competencies
Communicating with managers, supervisors, peers and/or subordinates
– providing information by telephone, in written form, e-mail or in person.
Making decisions and solving problems
– analyzing information and evaluating results to choose the best solution to solve problems.
Getting information
– observing, receiving and otherwise obtaining information from all relevant sources.
Drafting, laying out, and specifying technical devices, parts, and equipment
– providing documentation, detailed instructions, drawings, or specifications to tell others about how devices, parts, equipment, or structures are to be fabricated, constructed, assembled, modified, maintained, or used.
Thinking creatively
– developing, designing, or creating new applications, ideas, relationships, systems, or products, including artistic contributions.
Updating and using relevant knowledge
– keeping up-to-date technically and applying new knowledge to the job.
Coordinating the work and activities of others
– getting members of a group to work together to accomplish tasks.
Analyzing data or information
– identifying the underlying principles, reasons for facts of information by breaking down information or data into separate parts.
Important Skills and Abilities
Reading Comprehension
Mathematics
Active Listening
Critical Thinking
Complex Problem Solving
Coordination
Active Learning
Judgment and Decision Making
Written Comprehension
Oral Comprehension and Expression
Inductive Reasoning
Deductive Reasoning
Fluency of Ideas
Salary to be negotiated based on ability and experience.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $65,000.00-$85,000.00 per year
Benefits:
Dental care
Disability insurance
Extended health care
Work from home
Schedule:
8 hour shift

Title: Power Engineer 3/Maintenance Worker V - Victoria, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Description:
In accordance with the Vision, Purpose, and Values, and strategic direction of the Vancouver Island Health Authority (Island Health), patient & staff safety is a priority and a responsibility shared by everyone at VIHA; as such, the requirement to continuously improve quality and safety is inherent in all aspects of this position.
Reports to the Chief Engineer or designate. Operates, maintains and repairs site Power Plant and related equipment throughout the Facility or other SI VIHA facilities as assigned by performing duties such as operating boilers, generators, heating, air conditioning, exhaust systems and associated equipment. Through the site Building Automation System (BAS) monitors and adjusts systems temperatures, pressures and flows to maintain safe, efficient and comfortable. Performs trades duties approaching the journeyman level in one or a variety of trades areas such as electrical, plumbing, mechanical and carpentry in compliance with applicable codes and regulations.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Education, Training And Experience
Certificate of competency as a 3th Class Power Engineer recognized by the Province of BC. Two years recent related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience. Valid BC Drivers License.
Skills And Abilities
Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
Physical ability to perform the duties of the position.
Ability to read and interpret blueprints, drawings and specifications.
Ability to operate related equipment.
Ability to deal with others effectively.

Title: Mechanical Engineer-in-Training - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Overview / Responsibilities:
Wood services multiple markets including Infrastructure, Process & Energy and Mining & Minerals. Wood performs consulting and EPCM services for many local and worldwide companies and is executing world-class projects on five continents.
Wood currently has an exciting opportunity for a
Mechanical Engineer-in-Training
to join our
Mining & Minerals
business in our Vancouver, BC office. We offer a broad range of professional development and career growth opportunities and are committed to helping our staff achieve their potential. If you have exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, strong technical fundamentals, and thrive on challenges in a fast-paced environment, this is the opportunity for you.
Responsibilities:
Providing Mechanical/Piping engineering design for the construction of industrial facilities and services related to mining and mineral processing; including materials handling systems, fluid transfer systems, pressure vessels, heat exchangers, piping, air handling and other related industrial process equipment.
Contributing to the preparation of technical specifications and engineering input to material, construction and commissioning packages.
Material quantity take-offs
Providing engineering technical support to the field during construction, including responding to RFIs from construction contractor, issuing Site Instructions and performing field reviews
Supporting the development of proposals, study reports, engineering specifications, and contract documents
Establishing good working relationships and communication with internal and external stakeholders
Skills / Qualifications:
Graduate or Undergraduate Mechanical Engineering degree (graduating in 2020 or 2021), with the ability to register with Engineers and Geoscientists BC
Capable of developing creative yet practical solutions and is open-minded to alternative solutions.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English

Title: Metallurgist - Mississauga, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Group Introduction
Transforming mobility. Making automotive technology that is smarter, cleaner, safer and lighter. That’s what we’re passionate about at Magna Powertrain, and we do it by creating world-class powertrain systems. We are a premier supplier for the global automotive industry with full capabilities in design, development, testing and manufacturing of complex powertrain systems. Our name stands for quality, environmental consciousness, and safety. Innovation is what drives us and we drive innovation. Dream big and create the future of mobility at Magna Powertrain.
Role Summary
This position is responsible for the overall development, design, implementation, and execution of Precision Technologies Metallurgical and chemical processing operations Key Responsibilities
Responsible for establishment of strong research and development programs to support PT global light metal strategy and achieve company goals in light metal technology development.
Carry out research and developments to generate or apply advanced light metal technologies, such as new casting process and tooling design, implementation of new light materials and manufacturing process for producing large and complex leak tight powertrain components with reduced cost and improved quality and productivity. Flow simulation with use of Magna Software
Infrared imaging of production tools as well as hot spots on holding furnaces and melters
Responsible for the co-ordination of SR&ED claims in the department, materials testing lab set-up and operation, data analysis, preparation of technical proposals and reports, liaison with internal and external customers to understand the trend for light metal applications and explore new application and business for PT. Establish the collaboration and strengthen the links with Magna, Universities and research institutions for R&D activities Follow-up and correct, if required on process within the foundry. Work as a key team member in testing and validation of new tools and equipment for new product development and launch; Implement the technology for high volume production. Observes standards for safe working conditions as outlined in the Occupational Health and Safety Act as well as rules and regulations outlined in the employee handbook. Performs any and all other assignments from time to time as management so directs.
Key Qualifications/Requirements A PhD degree in metallurgy and materials engineering with extensive experience in the development of light metal automotive components is preferred but not required. A license to practice professional engineer in Ontario is an asset but not required. Demonstrated strong knowledge and experience in casting product development via new die casting processes, including, but not limited to Semi-Solid Metal (SSM) processing, squeeze casting, Vacuum and Magnesium die casting. Highly developed understanding of the triangle relationship of processing-microstructure-properties, with significant experience in casting alloy development and testing, materials characterization, mechanical metallurgy, heat treatment and mechanical properties. Strong knowledge of metal flow and solidification, heat transfer, runner/gate/venting/cooling design, familiar with numerical simulation of mould flow and solidification. Strong knowledge of world-wide alloy specifications, ASTM test methods, Project planning and management, design of experiments (DOE). Familiarity with TS16949 systems, automotive quality requirements such as APQP; PPAP; FEA; PFMEA; Control Plans; Warrants and SPC. Good interpersonal communication, proposal and report writing skills. Strong knowledge of materials characterization equipment and techniques, mechanical metallurgical testing equipment, die casting machine setting, melting, thermal analysis and heat treatment equipment. Knowledge of computer simulation and finite element analysis Knowledge of CAD software, 3-D modeling.
Additional Information
Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

Title: Junior Electrical Engineer, EIT - Calgary, AB - Indeed.com
Description:
Company
SKF Magnetic Bearings, a unit of SKF Canada Ltd.
Job Location
Calgary, Alberta, Canada
Position
1 year contract with possibility of extension.
Summary
SKF Magnetic Bearings in Calgary is a division of SKF Canada with a focus on the design and integration of magnetic levitation systems for leading-edge rotating machines used in particle science, semiconductor manufacturing, industrial and medical equipment, and gas compressors.
The right candidate will have excellent interpersonal skills and 100% commitment to the success of our customers and team to achieve the optimum performance in Quality, Cost, Service and Employee Satisfaction. This position involves the nexus of digital and analog electronics, embedded programming, and magnetics.
Job Purpose
We are seeking a highly motivated, technically oriented EIT/Electrical Engineer to support the production of serial Magnetic Bearing products. This support is focused primarily on our magnetic bearing controllers, cables, position sensors and system level troubleshooting. The engineer will be responsible for improving the quality and cost of the product by eliminating production waste through the continuous improvement of production and test production documentation. The position also requires supporting the evolving Environmental and Safety Regulations for our products.
Roles and Responsibilities:
Testing, validation and troubleshooting of prototypes and field failures of complex electromechanical systems
Strong troubleshooting skills at a system and card level
Failure Analysis and Corrective and Preventive Actions for Customer Returns
Maintenance of technical documentation, drawings and procedures using an ECO process
Technical report writing to document the results of testing, validation and troubleshooting activities
Six Sigma Tools: FMEA, 8D Root Cause Analysis, etc.
Sourcing and specification of commercially available as well as customized components for use in magnetic bearing designs
Schematic and PCB layout
Embedded C programming of DSP and ARM processors
FPGA programming
Product support for compliance with Environmental Regulations such as RoHS, REACH, TSCA, POP, etc
Product support for compliance with Electrical Safety, Immunity and Emissions regulations (i.e CSA, UL, CE)
Qualifications:
Self-motivated, willing to learn and attention to detail
Degree in Electrical Engineering
Experience in Mechatronics and Control Systems is not required but considered an asset
Registration as a P. Eng. or an
E
ngineer
I
n
T
raining with APEGA
0-5 years of electrical/software experience
Ability to assemble what you design; this position requires excellent design skills and the ability to work with what you have built
Previous experience with the design of electronic circuits is an asset
Familiarity with the principles on Electro-Magnetics is an asset
Able to work under pressure to meet deadlines
Ability to manage time across multiple projects
Willingness to accept mentorship from senior engineers
Ability to mentor and direct Engineering Interns as your experience grows
When applying for this position please submit your resume, cover letter and transcript of your Engineering marks. We thank all applicants for their interest, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Working Environment:
Primarily office, laboratory and production facility environments
Scrum Team
Tight timelines may arise
Casual work attire, unless otherwise required
COVID-19 Precautions:
Personal protective equipment provided or required
Temperature screenings
Social distancing guidelines in place
Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place
What You’ll Love About SKF:
Rest and Relaxation. Enjoy a robust vacation, statutory holidays as well as sick day policies!
Work/Life Balance. A possibility for flexibility and an opportunity for occasional remote work.
Health and Wellness Benefits. SKF cares about the wellbeing of our employees. We have a comprehensive Benefits Package.
Invest in your Future. SKF offers a Defined contribution plan opportunity to have up to 6% contribution matched (on base salary).
Much more! Growth opportunities, tuition reimbursement,
employee assistance program, life insurance, and with so many benefits to working for SKF, we could not name them all!
EOE M/F

Title: Commissioning EIT (Engineering new graduate) – Saskatoon, SK
Position Summary:
Hatch is seeking a Commissioning EIT with interest in metals, mining, energy, water treatment and/or infrastructure. Reporting to the Regional Director of Commissioning for Western Canada the EIT will support commissioning projects in the Western Canada region working from the Saskatoon office and at project offices as required.
What Will a Career at Hatch Offer You:
You will:
Be given opportunities to contribute to complex projects around the world in meaningful ways
Work on problems and gain experience in the office and on project sites
Collaborate with diverse teams locally and globally
Work in an exciting environment where you can apply your academic learning on a daily basis
Gain relevant experience and support in obtaining your professional designation
Benefit from formal and informal mentorship from some of the leading minds and authorities in the industry
Participate in local Professional Development Programs, Sustainability Week, Toastmasters, and more to develop your skills
Join in charitable, social, and sports activities with other Hatch employees
We’re entrepreneurs with a technical soul. Our flat organizational structure creates an atmosphere of openness and participation. We build practical solutions that are safe, innovative, and sustainable. Our ultimate goal is to achieve no harm for our people, our clients, and our communities.
Responsibilities:
Support commissioning planning and setup activities
Provide technical input for testing and data collection during the pre-commissioning and commissioning phase of the project
Lead technology development initiatives in the group including investigating of alternate and supporting commissioning software
Lead setup and implementation of the commissioning management system and become a support resource for global projects on the corresponding software(s)
Provide input to technology initiatives to improve the efficiency of the commissioning process and a different perspective on approaches to execution
Develop test plans and commissioning procedures
Participate in field testing and troubleshoot/optimize equipment that is not performing
Manage the test results, data collection, progress measurement and documentation of results
Support development of commissioning estimates, budgets, forecasts, schedules, commissioning proposals and presentations
Coordinate with construction planning team to align commissioning systems are coordinated with construction work packages, engineering and procurement
Review P&IDs, Flow Diagrams, Single Line Diagram, Network Architecture Drawings and engineering registers to prepare an execution plan and estimate to execute pre-commissioning and commissioning services and identify opportunities for project acceleration
Establish the commissioning requirements for pre-fabrication and modularization.
Education and Experience:
A new graduate with a Bachelor of Engineering or Bachelor of Applied Science in Chemical, Process, Mechanical, Metallurgical, or Mining Engineering
Excel academically while being actively involved in extra-curricular and/or volunteer activities at school or in the community
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications. Experience using Visio or similar tools to communicate commissioning sequence, organizational charts and work flow processes is an asset
Effective report writing skills, planning and organizational skills
Previous co-op experience in project execution, commissioning, or construction on industrial project is considered an asset
This role requires some travel to various Hatch offices, project and supplier sites subject to project requirements
Aspirations of becoming a commissioning manager, project manager or group lead are considered an asset
Competencies (knowledge, skill, attributes):
Good understanding of engineering and business fundamentals as they apply to engineering problems and projects
Ability to learn quickly and to take on new challenges
Collaborative team player with excellent interpersonal skills
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Shows critical and creative thinking and problem solving, and brings forward solutions for our clients' toughest challenges
Adapts and embraces change
NOTE: Note: You must
submit a transcript
(official or unofficial) upon application to be considered for role.
We are committed to fostering a workforce in each of our locations that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate. Hatch is an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers employment applicants without regard to age, race, colour, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, disability or any other protected status. If you have any special needs requirements, please let us know. We will do our utmost to accommodate, in accordance with applicable local legislation.

Title: Mechanical Engineer - Fort McMurray, AB - Indeed.com
Description:
Overview / Responsibilities:
Wood is seeking to add a Mechanical Engineer to support our project teams in Calgary, Edmonton and Fort McMurray. Successful candidate will be based in the Wood Fort McMurray office.
Responsibilities:
In-depth knowledge in either one or more of the following areas:
Rotating Equipment (slurry pumps, process water pumps, air-compressors, steam/gas turbines, etc.);
Stationary Equipment (pressure vessels, heat exchangers, tanks, etc.);
On-Pond Assets (barges, dredges, etc.);
Materials Handling (cranes, davits, etc.).
Generating new Mechanical specifications, expand / update current specifications, preparing deviation on specifications.
Generating technical decision records and project decision records as related to Mechanical engineering.
Create, specify, and maintain data sheets for Mechanical Equipment such that the items can be purchased.
Compilation of RFQs c/w specifications, scopes, and data sheets.
Review quotations from suppliers and perform a technical bid evaluation of the equipment offered.
Make a technical assessments and recommendations when required.
Post purchase order placement package management, including review and approval of supplier documentation for the equipment.
